reporting_cycle: Secretary-General reports no later than 15 September 2013
summary:
Encourages a transition steering group to map international support to Sierra Leone.
Here is a concise summary of the Security Council document:

The Security Council:

* Requests the Secretary-General to finalize a Transition Plan by May 30, 2013, and provide an update on planning activities.
* Encourages the Government of Sierra Leone to discuss the UN role post-UNIPSIL with stakeholders.
* Requests UNIPSIL to focus on facilitating political dialogue, security sector support, and human rights institutions.
* Encourages the UN Country Team to scale up activities and programming during UNIPSIL's transition.
* Requests the Secretary-General to provide a peace and development advisor to support the Resident Coordinator.
* Welcomes the planned review of the 1991 Constitution and calls for an open, transparent, and constructive process.
* Calls on Sierra Leone's electoral institutions to foster an environment of political inclusion and ensure peaceful, inclusive, and credible elections.
* Urges the passing of the Gender Equality Bill and implementation of the National Gender Strategic Plan.
* Encourages the Government to improve youth employment and empowerment and reduce socioeconomic inequalities.
* Welcomes the work of the Sierra Leone Human Rights Commission and encourages international support.
* Urges the Independent Media Commission to ensure compliance with the Media Code of Practice.
* Calls on the Government to ensure impartial and effective security agencies and accelerate efforts to establish the Independent Police Complaints Committee.
* Reaffirms the potential role of extractive industries in Sierra Leone's economic development and encourages transparent regulation and oversight.
* Emphasizes the Government's primary responsibility for peacebuilding and long-term development.
* Calls on international partners to continue financial and technical support to Sierra Leone.
* Requests the Peacebuilding Commission to continue support and review its engagement with a view to scaling down its role.
* Decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
